page.title: 07SOLWAY VIADUCT,ANNAN
page.content: Many of us play along the dismantled railway line which now carries a pipeline of waste cooling water from Chapelcross Atomic Power Station to the Solway Firth. When the old railway line existed it was used mainly for transporting iron ore from Cumberland to steel works in Lanarkshire.A viaduct was built across the Solway.Four thousand tons of iron were used to build the Solway Viaduct which measured 1940 yards in length-at that time the longest bridge in Britain!It was opened on 13/9/1869. Six years later frost damaged part of the Viaduct.In 1881 ice sheets from the rivers caused so much damage that it became unsafe.Repairs took three years to complete.By then cheap Spanish ore was replacing the Cumbrian ore.It was finally demolished in 1934 leaving only the embankments.
